card.description: Multi-decade data on individual billionaires, ranked for each year, with features like age, industry, family wealth, and wealth type (e.g. company founder in the finance industry).

context.potentialUses: Predict the type of a billionare's wealth based on other features.
context.potentialMisuses: For example, determining whether men are 'better' at becoming billionaires than women. Women are underrepresented among billionaires, but there are a lot of reasons for that the data doesn't reflect.

fields.description: Their wealth rank for the year of this record.
The year of the rankings (1996, 2001, or 2014).
The year their company was founded.
Their relationship to the company: e.g. "founder", "CEO", "chairman").
The sector their company is in, e.g. "Finance" or "Software".
The type of company: whether it was new, a privatized company, or an acquired company.
The country where they are an official citizen.
The region their country of residence is in, e.g. "North America" or "East Asia"
Their type of wealth, e.g. : "founder non-finance", "inherited", "self-made finance"
Their net worth in billions of dollars.
Their category of wealth, e.g. "Financial", "Non-Traded", or "Traded Sectors".
The industry their wealth is in.
Whether their wealth was inherited and where from, e.g. "not inherited", "father", "3rd generation".
